message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.NI

Reasoning: The paper deals with bounds on codes with locality and availability, which are concepts related to information theory and coding theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also presents constructions for codes with locality and availability, which could fall under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) or cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Additionally, the paper discusses the intersection between supports of rows in the parity-check matrix, which could be related to sparsity and compressed sensing, falling under cs.SI (Signal and Image Processing). Finally, the paper deals with error-correcting codes, which could be related to network coding and communication, falling under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture).
